headline.main: Closer Look At New Plan For Trying Terrorists

lead_paragraph: A day after President Bush signed an order allowing special military tribunals to try foreigners charged with terrorism, a more detailed picture of what government planners envision began to emerge. Witnesses would be sworn to tell the truth, just as they are in American courtrooms. But they might testify behind closed doors, a Bush administration official said yesterday.
abstract: Article discusses military tribunals, which will try foreigners as proposed by Bush administration, and enacted by executive order; focuses on details of process and history of other courts of war; while there are precedents for such trials, some question whether president has constitutional authority to implement them; photo (M)
